title: Biblical Apocalypse Everywhere! January 2018 via Paul Begley (Video)
text:
By Jeffery Pritchett
Thursday, January 18, 2018 14:13
 
“Joseph, son of David, do not fear to take Mary your wife,
for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit;
She will bear a son and you are to name him Jesus,
because he will save his people from their sins.”
Gospel of Matthew 1:20-21
This took place in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
The next day he saw Jesus coming toward him, and said,
“Behold, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!”
Gospel of John 1:28-29
The Revelation of Jesus Christ is a book of prophecy on the end times and comprises the final book of the New Testament and of the Bible.
The Greek word for Revelation is Αποκαλυψις or Apocalypse. Revelation always implies the unveiling of something previously hidden, in this case, future events. As the final book of the Bible, the Book of Revelation brings to fruition symbolism found in Genesis 3:15 in the first book of the Bible.
Early Christian Tradition identified the writer of Revelation as the Apostle St. John, the Beloved Disciple, while he was in exile on the island of Patmos in the Aegean Sea. Written in symbolism, the book has always been surrounded by mystery and has fascinated mankind throughout the ages as to its meaning.
The Apocalypse opens with “The Revelation of Jesus Christ,” the prophecy revealed to the Evangelist John by the risen Christ, “who loves us and has freed us from our sins by his blood” (1:5).
I added a new Paul B. video to the line up here. Let us know what you think in the comments section and thanks for stopping by BIN Prophecy!

Jan 19, 2018, 5:12 am
Firmament Does Exist
Who cares what the “Greek” says…..ChazUW YAHUW MeoshiYAch ( The Revelation through YAHUW Eternal King of the Family in Yasarel), ChazUW YAHUW (Revelation through YAHUW)…..ChazUW YAHUW 1:1 This is the ChazUW (Revelation of YAHUW) of YAHUW MeoshiYAch, which YAHUWAH The Father gave Him to show His servants concerning the things which shall come which He sent and made known by His angels to His servant, YAHUWchanon ( YAHUW is Covenant Forgiveness).
Jan 19, 2018, 7:21 am
Yochanan (John) was overseeing the tevilah ( https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ritual_washing_in_Judaism ) in a miqveh ( https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mikveh ) at Bethabara ( https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bethabara ), and it was certainly NOT beyond the Jordan; it was on the west bank (Israel side) of the Jordan River.  Nahar HaYarden or Jordan River qualified as a miqveh as its “living waters” originated with a natural spring — the Banias at the foot of Mount Hermon ( https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jordan_River#Tributaries ).
Picture this… Bethabara or “place of the crossing” was where the Israelites from the Egyptian Exodus crossed into the Promised Land led by Joshua, the son of Nun.  Note that they had to consecrate themselves (via tevilah!) before crossing.  This exact same place was where Yehoshu’a HaMashiach (Joshua the Messiah) was consecrated (via tevilah!) just before being anointed in the Holy Spirit.  So, just as Joshua, the son of Nun, led the Israelites to the Promised Land, so too does Joshua, the Son of God, lead us to salvation.
I created a Google map with more information… https://tinyurl.com/yd3crfyw
Shema Yisrael!
For those who don’t believe this, the earliest extant manuscript containing John 1:28 was from Papyrus 66; see https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Papyrus_66 .  Regardless of the dating — which ranges from the second to fourth centuries, it is NOT from the first century CE and was discovered in Egypt ( https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bodmer_Papyri ).  Again, the “early church fathers” were hard at work in disguising the truth!
Jan 19, 2018, 9:23 am
Firmament Does Exist
YAHUWchanon 1:28 These things were done among the BethaniYA (Covenant-Famlies of YA) beyond the YArdan where YAHUWchanon was immersing for repentance of breaking The Covenant Words.
Jan 19, 2018, 6:09 pm
Did you not read about John 1:28 and Papyrus 66?
Jan 19, 2018, 7:09 pm
The earliest extant map of the area is the Madaba map; see https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madaba_Map .  Where is Bethabara?  On the WESTERN side of the Jordan (NOT beyond!)  Where is Gilgal (lit. “stone circle” from Joshua 4) — denoted as Dodekalithon (lit. twelve stones)?  Have the memorial stones ever been found although they were to serve as a memorial FOREVER?  It’s because NO ONE is looking in the right place!
Jan 19, 2018, 7:18 pm
Matthew 3:1 Now in those days John the Baptist *came, preaching in the WILDERNESS OF JUDEA [emphasis mine], saying, 2 “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.” 3 For this is the one referred to by Isaiah the prophet when he said,
“The voice of one crying in the wilderness,
‘Make ready the way of the Lord,
Make His paths straight!’” (NASB)
Is Judea — and specifically the (desert) wilderness of Judea — in Perea (modern Jordan on the eastern side of the Jordan River)?  See https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judea and https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judaean_Desert .  Yochanan was part of the “sect” called THE WAY in Qumran; he was the voice crying out in the (Judean desert) wilderness (in Qumran).
Matthew 3:13 Then Jesus arrived from Galilee at the Jordan coming to John, to be baptized by him. (NASB)
Is Galiee on the western (Israel) or eastern (Perea/Jordan) side of the Jordan River? https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Galilee
Mark 1:9 In those days Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan. 10 Immediately coming up out of the water, He saw the heavens opening, and the Spirit like a dove descending upon Him; 11 and a voice came out of the heavens: “You are My beloved Son, in You I am well-pleased.”
12 Immediately the Spirit impelled Him to go out into the wilderness. 13 And He was in the wilderness forty days being tempted by Satan; and He was with the wild beasts, and the angels were ministering to Him. (NASB)
Again, where is Nazareth?  East or west of the Jordan River?  See https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazareth .  Where did He go immediately after His tevilah?  Where is that (desert) wilderness?
Luke 3:1 Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, when Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea, and Herod was tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip was tetrarch of the region of Ituraea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias was tetrarch of Abilene, 2 in the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John, the son of Zacharias, in the wilderness. 3 And he came into all the district around the Jordan, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins; 4 as it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet,
“The voice of one crying in the wilderness,
‘Make ready the way of the Lord,
Make His paths straight.
And every mountain and hill will be brought low;
The crooked will become straight,
And the rough roads smooth;
6 6 And all flesh will see the salvation of God.’” (NASB)
The Word of God came to Yochanan where?  In the Judean desert wilderness at Qumran!  See https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qumran .  Where was Qumran?  The West Bank!
Where was Yochanan preaching a tevilah of repentance?  Around the JUDEAN district around the Jordan River.
So, BEYOND the Jordan makes no sense and is contrary to the other three Gospels…
Jan 19, 2018, 7:56 pm

Dr Frank Logsdon, project member of the translation committee for the New American Standard Version (NASB) has dennounced his work on that translation and is urging all Christian’s to return to the “authorized version” KJV. Although the most popular version at the present time is the New International Version (NIV). Both of these modern versions are based on the same Catholic text and Logsdon concerns apply to both. Being involved in the project from the very beginning, Logsdon helped publisher F Dewey Lockman with the feasibility study that led to the translation. He interviewed some of the translators, say with them, even wrote the preface. His old friend Dr David Otis Fuller put his finger on the many shortcomings of the two Catholic manuscripts. I prefer translations that use the original Hebrew like The Scriptures, Institute for Scriptural Research and The Word Of YAH, Kindom of YAH from The Original Scriptures.

Rabbinic Jews recite “Adonai” (=lord) for the Tetragrammaton, yet that invokes the Greek Adonis (aka the Babylonian Tammuz).
Jan 20, 2018, 7:10 am
And, before the discovery of the Dead Sea Scrolls, the Septuagint (LXX) was the oldest extant manuscript of the TaNaKh; see https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Septuagint .  The Masoretic Text (MT) wasn’t written until MUCH later; see https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masoretic_Text .
It’s funny how both Joshua, the son of Nun, in the LXX and Joshua, the son of God, in the NT were BOTH recorded as ‘Iesous (Heb. Yehoshu’a).  Jesus is the transliteration of the Latin — NOT the translation.
Jan 20, 2018, 7:19 am
And, the Catholic church ensured that any NT texts NEVER would be published from the Dead Sea Scrolls.  A good book on that subject is “The Dead Sea Scrolls Deception” by Michael Baigent & Richard Leigh.
Jan 19, 2018, 8:47 pm
Jan 19, 2018, 8:53 pm
But, let’s prove that this is an urban legend…
Acts 12:4 And when he had apprehended him, he put him in prison, and delivered him to four quaternions of soldiers to keep him; intending after Easter to bring him forth to the people. (KJV)
Acts 12:4 When he had seized him, he put him in prison, delivering him to four squads of soldiers to guard him, intending after the Passover to bring him out before the people. (NASB)
The Word in question in Koine Greek is pascha; see http://biblehub.com/greek/3957.htm .
Let’s look at the etymology of Easter; see https://www.etymonline.com/word/easter .
“Old English Easterdæg, from Eastre (Northumbrian Eostre), from Proto-Germanic *austron-, “dawn,” also the name of a goddess of fertility and spring, perhaps originally of sunrise, whose feast was celebrated at the spring equinox, from *aust- “east, toward the sunrise” (compare east), from PIE root *aus- (1) “to shine,” especially of the dawn.”
First, is Easter Passover?  Second, would the Most High have ANYTHING to do with a spring fertility goddess of the dawn?  Now, you know why Easter is a sunrise service!  This would be considered a doctrine of demons (assimilated paganism).
Yehoshu’a was crucified as the Passover Lamb on 14 Abib in 36 CE.  As His alleged crime was blasphemy, a crime punishable by death, He was to be hung on a tree:
Deuteronomy 21:22 “If a man has committed a sin worthy of death and he is put to death, and you hang him on a tree, 23 his corpse shall not hang all night on the tree, but you shall surely bury him on the same day (for he who is hanged is accursed of God), so that you do not defile your land which the Lord your God gives you as an inheritance. (NASB)
He was buried that same day (14 Abib) before the first day of Unleavened Bread on 15 Abib, which is an ANNUAL Sabbath.  He was dead and buried three days and NIGHTS per the sign of Jonah (15-17 Abib) and descended into Sheol, which in Greek was translated as Hades; see https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Matthew+12%3A38-40%3B+Acts+2%3A22-36&version=NASB .
He arose/was resurrected as Lord of the WEEKLY Sabbath on 18 Abib, and His empty tomb was discovered on the first day of the week (19 Abib) — JUST AS THE SCRIPTURES STATE AND THE DEAD SEA SCROLLS ATTEST!
The Catholic church has done everything in its power to remove the Hebraic roots of the Word and replace them with paganism.  That carried over into Protestantism after the Reformatio — including the KJV.
The only thing in Christmas is Mithra(s), and Easter is a pagan fertility rite; hence, the eggs and bunnies.  The “authorized” King James (1611) Version included such paganism.  Is it truly of God?  You know the answer…
